intro: Ficus bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia fig, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Brazil. It belongs to the Moraceae family and is characterized by its glossy, broad leaves that are typically dark green in color. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible fig fruits. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Ficus bahiensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to indoor conditions.
